description: Erection of two semi-detached houses following demolition of the existing bungalow
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted ([Planning Statement], [Fire Safety Statement], [Unnumbered Location Plan], [10], [11], [12], Received: 13/07/2022, [Energy Statement], [Residential Energy Consumption and CO2 Analysis], [Full SAP Calculation Printout-1], [Full SAP Calculation Printout-2], 14/10/2022, [01], [02], [03], [04], [05], Received: 20/12/2022) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - Materials

No development shall take place above ground level until samples of all materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.
- brick (including brick, feature brick panel, brick framing
feature);
- Tiles/ Roof covering;
- Coping
- window treatment (including sections/reveals, quoin
detail, screens);
- all privacy measures; and
- any other materials/details to be used.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter.
Condition : 4 - Cycle Storage

No development (except any demolition, site clearance, ground investigation and remediation work) shall take place until full details (including manufacturers specifications) of secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than 2 bicycles for each dwelling) for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use before the development is first occupied or brought into use and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.
Condition : 5 - Construction Logistics Plan 

Prior to commencement of development, a Construction Logistics Plan shall be submitted to an approved by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall take place in accordance with the details approved. The CLP must contain the following details:
o	A site plan;
o	A pre-start record of site condition on the adjoining public highway to be agreed with the Council;
o	Provision for the parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors; 
o	Provision for loading and unloading of plant and materials used in constructing the development; 
o	Provision for the storage of plan and materials used in constructing the development;
o	The erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate; 
o	Wheel washing facilities at the site exit; 
o	Measures to control the emission of dust and dirt during construction; 
o	A scheme for recycling/ disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works; 
o	Appropriate vehicle routes to and from the site; 
o	Measures to ensure the safety of all users of the public highway especially in the vicinity of the site; 
o	Use of operators committed to best practice, demonstrated by membership of TFL's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme, or similar; 
o	Measures to promote sustainable travel to work; and
o	Swept path analysis for HGV's including dustcarts.
Condition : 6 - Energy Statement
A.	The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved 'Energy Statement' received: 14/10/2022. 
B.	Prior to first occupation of any dwelling within the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy.
C.	Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, performance data for energy consumption must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The performance data shall be submitted every 18 months to a monitoring web-platform for a period of three years from the point of full operation.
Condition : 7 - Water efficiency

Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.
Condition : 8 - Sustainable Sourcing of Materials 

The developments shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:
o	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
o	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
o	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone. 
Condition : 9 - Drainage

Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant shall have submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing a final detailed drainage design, including drawings and supporting calculations [and an updated Drainage Assessment Form to be reviewed and approved by the Lead Local Flood Authority. The drainage hierarchy should make use of green infrastructure technology to comply with the hierarchy set out in London Plan Policy SI3 and the runoff rate should not exceed 2 litres/second.  A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components shall also be submitted and approved which demonstrates how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the approved details. 
Condition : 10 - Evidence of drainage

No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.
Condition : 11 - Landscaping
Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to the occupation of the hereby approved development, details of hard and soft landscaping, including planting, hard and soft surfaces and boundary treatment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and retained as such thereafter. Any trees or plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another tree or plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation. 
Condition : 12 - No additional windows
No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the walls of any dwelling hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 13 - Permitted Development Restrictions
Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 1995 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order), no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings/enclosures within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out, other than as shown in the approved drawings and, no additional floor space shall be formed within the building(s) hereby permitted by means of internal horizontal division (new mezzanine level) without prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 14 - Waste Storage 
Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, a waste storage capacity including 1 x 140 litre refuse bin, 1 x 23 litre food bin, 1 x 5 litre food caddy (for internal use), 1 x 55 litre red plastic and can recycling box, 1 x 55 litre blue cardboard and paper recycling box, and 1 x 55 litre green glass recycling box shall be made available for use and thereafter shall be retained for such use at all times without obstruction. Bins shall be stored within the store at all times and shall not be left on the public highway.
Condition : 15 - Reinstatement of footway and kerb
Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the existing vehicular access from Gould Road shall be permanently closed and kerbs and footway reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.
